alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued February 21 at 1:31PM MST until February 24 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Dangerous wind chills expected, along with periods of light snowfall. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 2 inches. Wind chills as low as 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Far southeast Wyoming into the southern Nebraska Panhandle including Cheyenne, Pine Bluffs, Scottsbluff, Kimball, and Sidney. * WHEN...5 PM MST this evening through 11 AM MST Thursday February 24th. Best chance for accumulating snowfall tonight through early Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to frostbite on exposed skin in less than 10 minutes. Hypothermia can develop quickly if precautions are not taken. In addition, some roadways may become slick or snow covered where heavier snow falls.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie County; East Laramie County; South Laramie Range Foothills
